full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 50 of 236 LC3KMAX2 Alessi - Cross 1 (At the sidebar) 2 MR. PAGLIUCA: I apologize, your Honor. It was completely unintentional. I apologize. 3 4 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, given that Mr. Pagliuca represented that he had prepared to cross-examine this witness on this testimony, I think we need to have a plan going forward for how to make sure this does not happen again because, clearly, Mr. Pagliuca had not prepared enough. 5 6 7 8 THE COURT: The witness herself did the same thing. It happens. My perception was that it was an accident. 9 10 MR. PAGLIUCA: Completely. 11 12 THE COURT: I agree, we need a plan, but -- 13 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I would propose that to the extent Mr. Pagliuca intends to use some sort of prior inconsistent statement, that he can discuss it with me before reading it into the record, and we can confer about how he should read it. 14 15 16 17 MR. PAGLIUCA: I understand how to read, your Honor. It won't happen again. 18 19 THE COURT: All right. It won't happen again. 20 21 MR. PAGLIUCA: It will not. 22 23 THE COURT: If it happens again, we're going to need a different approach. 24 25 MR. PAGLIUCA: I understand. It will not happen again. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018151

text_blocks.content: (At the sidebar) MR. PAGLIUCA: I apologize, your Honor. It was completely unintentional. I apologize. MS. COMEY: Your Honor, given that Mr. Pagliuca represented that he had prepared to cross-examine this witness on this testimony, I think we need to have a plan going forward for how to make sure this does not happen again because, clearly, Mr. Pagliuca had not prepared enough. THE COURT: The witness herself did the same thing. It happens. My perception was that it was an accident. MR. PAGLIUCA: Completely. THE COURT: I agree, we need a plan, but -- MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I would propose that to the extent Mr. Pagliuca intends to use some sort of prior inconsistent statement, that he can discuss it with me before reading it into the record, and we can confer about how he should read it. MR. PAGLIUCA: I understand how to read, your Honor. It won't happen again. THE COURT: All right. It won't happen again. MR. PAGLIUCA: It will not. THE COURT: If it happens again, we're going to need a different approach. MR. PAGLIUCA: I understand. It will not happen again.
